title: Define UI state machine and view modes
description:
Define the state machine for the adaptive UI:

**View Modes:**
1. `idle` - No logo exists, chat is prominent, welcome state
2. `generating` - AI is creating logo, loading state with progress
3. `reviewing` - Logo exists, preview dominant, chat as sidebar

**State Transitions:**
- idle → generating (user sends first message)
- generating → reviewing (logo generated)
- reviewing → generating (user requests changes)

**Deliverable:**
- TypeScript types for view modes
- State derivation logic based on svg/isLoading state
close_reason: Closed

title: Create Settings Drawer component
description:
Extract ConfigPanel into a slide-out drawer that's hidden by default.

**Design:**
- Slides in from the left edge
- Triggered by floating gear button
- Contains all current ConfigPanel functionality
- Closes when clicking outside or pressing X
- Smooth animation (300ms ease-out)

**Purpose:**
- Settings are 'advanced' - most users just talk to AI
- Reduces visual clutter in default state
- Still accessible for power users who want manual control

**Philosophy Alignment:**
- Invisible Interface: Hide unless needed
- Progressive Disclosure: Reveal complexity on demand
close_reason: Closed

title: Logo RAG System with ChromaDB
description: Add a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system to improve logo generation quality by providing similar logo examples from a curated database. SVG logos are ingested, described using Claude Vision, embedded via Workers AI, and stored in ChromaDB Cloud for semantic retrieval.
close_reason: All Logo RAG System with ChromaDB components implemented

close_reason: All Phase 1 RAG foundation components implemented

title: Implement checkpoint and resume capability
description: Write completed URLs to checkpoint JSON after each batch. Support --resume flag to continue from last checkpoint. Handle SIGINT gracefully.

title: Redesign Generator UI: Adaptive Layout Based on Philosophy
description:
Redesign the Logo Generator UI to reduce cognitive load and embrace the philosophy.md principles:

**Current Problems:**
- Three-panel layout (config, preview, chat) all visible at once - too crowded
- User forced to context-switch between panels constantly
- Settings panel demands attention even when not needed
- Not embracing the 'Editor Mindset' or 'Invisible Interface' principles

**Philosophy Principles to Apply:**
1. **Editor Mindset** - User reviews/approves AI work, not doing data entry
2. **Adaptive UX** - Interface transforms based on intent and context  
3. **Invisible Interface** - Surface only what's relevant to the current task
4. **Consent & Clarity** - AI proposes, user approves in collaborative loop

**Target State:**
- Chat-first experience for initial intent capture
- Preview dominant when reviewing generated logos
- Settings hidden by default, revealed contextually
- Progressive disclosure - start simple, reveal complexity as needed
- State-based layout that adapts: idle → generating → reviewing
close_reason: Closed

title: Create Reviewing View: Preview-dominant layout
description:
Create the reviewing state view when a logo has been generated.

**Design:**
- Preview canvas takes center stage (70-80% of viewport)
- Chat becomes a collapsible right sidebar panel
- Floating action buttons for settings/chat toggle
- Version strip at bottom when multiple versions exist
- Export/Save controls integrated into preview header

**Layout:**
- Main area: Full-bleed preview with zoom controls
- Right panel: Sliding chat drawer (can close to maximize preview)
- Left panel: Settings drawer (hidden by default, slides in)
- Bottom: Version thumbnails strip (optional, shows when >1 version)

**Philosophy Alignment:**
- Editor Mindset: User reviews AI output prominently
- Adaptive UX: Interface transforms to prioritize review

title: Add floating action buttons and version strip
description:
Add floating UI elements for quick access to common actions.

**Floating Action Buttons (bottom-right):**
- Settings gear button (toggles settings drawer)
- Chat button (only shows when chat is closed in reviewing mode)
- Both use 48px circular buttons with shadows

**Version Strip (bottom-center):**
- Only visible when versions.length > 1
- Shows count: '3 versions'
- 'View all' button opens version history
- Pill-shaped container with blur backdrop

**Design Notes:**
- Position: fixed relative to container
- Subtle shadows and backdrop blur for floating effect
- Smooth appearance animations

title: Add smooth state transitions and animations
description:
Polish the UI with smooth transitions between states.

**State Transitions:**
- idle → generating: Fade out welcome, show loading
- generating → reviewing: Slide in preview, expand canvas
- Panel open/close: 300ms ease-out slide animations

**Micro-interactions:**
- Button hover states
- Focus rings for accessibility
- Loading spinner animation
- Version strip appearance

**CSS Approach:**
- Use Tailwind transition utilities
- Duration: 300-500ms for panels, 150-200ms for buttons
- Easing: ease-out for entrances, ease-in for exits

**Accessibility:**
- Respect prefers-reduced-motion
- Maintain keyboard focus management

description:

- Smooth animation (300ms ease-out)

- Can be closed to maximize preview space

- Adaptive UX: Secondary to preview but always accessible
